sense.name: before noon
sense.commentary: MORNING[+event] morning, morn, morning time - the time period between dawn and noon
sense.examples: Morning will be from 6:45 - 12:00. I spend the morning running errands. She slept all morning. George got up at 11:30 in the morning.

sense.name: daybreak
sense.commentary: MORNING[+event] dawn, dawning, aurora, first light, break of day, dayspring, sunrise, sunup, cockcrow - the first light of day
sense.examples: Morning will be at 5:47. We got up before morning. They talked until morning.

sense.name: beginning
sense.commentary: MORNING[+event] dawn - the earliest period (of something other than a day)
sense.examples: The morning of civilization. The morning of the world.

sense.name: good morning
sense.commentary: morning - a conventional expression of greeting or farewell
sense.examples: Good morning. Sally said "Morning" to everyone she passed in the street.
